tiles.markdownText:
# VS Code Extension Copilot Language Tools Experince

All the data presented in the following section is specifically focused on language tool invocation events within **Copilot Chat**. Events unrelated to Copilot Chat are excluded from this analysis. For example, if a user executes a command from another product that does not involve a language tool, that event is not counted here.

Therefore, when we say that a user only used one product during a session in the views below, it does **not** mean the user didnt interact with or install other products. It simply means that, in that particular session, only one products language tool was invoked.

tiles.title: # of Language Tool Runs by Session
# of Starting/Terminal Language Tool by Session
# of Language Tool Runs by Tool Name
# of Terminal Language Tool with Multiple Attempts
# of Language Tool in Single-language-tool-run Session
New tile
tiles.markdownText:
## Product Cohesion

As an integrated system, we aim for as many users as possible to use **AppCAT**, **Code Remediation**, and **Java Upgrade** together. If most users are not using all the productsor are only using onewe should consider whether the unified installation experience and the functional alignment across the suite need optimization.

In the **Starting/Terminal Product** view, we can analyze whether user behavior aligns with our expectations by looking at which product is launched first and which one is used last in each session. If the data doesnt match our expectations, it could indicate that certain products are encountering friction points that prevent users from continuing, leading to a higher rate of those products being the terminal point. Alternatively, it might suggest that some product entry points are not prominent enough, making it difficult for users to begin their workflow there.

In the **Product Used in Single-product Sessions** view, users who only used **Code Remediation** likely encountered issues during the installation of **AppCAT**. On the other hand, users who only used **AppCAT** may have triggered the AppCAT CLI through means other than the Copilot Chat interfacefor example, by executing a VS Code command that invokes the AppCAT CLI.

tiles.title: New tile
tiles.markdownText:
## Language Tool Overview

We consider a single VS Code session as one user operation. Ideally, we want users to smoothly invoke multiple language tools within a single session to support their work. If, in most cases, users only run a fewor even just onelanguage tool per session, we need to further investigate why they are not leveraging more tools. Is it because they encounter difficulties when using certain tools, or is it that a small number of tool invocations are usually sufficient to meet their needs?

The duration of each session can partially reflect the completeness of a users operation. Very short sessions may indicate that users encountered unresolved issues and abandoned their tasks midway.

In the **Starting/Terminal Language Tool** view, we can analyze whether user behavior aligns with our expectations by examining which language tool is triggered first and which one is triggered last in each session. If the data doesnt meet our expectations, it may suggest that certain tools are causing friction during use, leading to a higher frequency of those tools being the terminal point. Alternatively, it could mean that some tools have entry points that are not prominent enough, making it difficult for users to begin their workflow with them.

The **# of Terminal Language Tool with Multiple Attempts** view highlights language tools that users attempted to execute multiple times before ending their session. If these tools are not expected to be used repeatedly before task completion, it may indicate that users encountered difficulties while using them. Despite multiple attempts, they were unable to proceed with their workflow successfully, which ultimately led to the session ending with that tool.

The **# of Terminal Language Tool in Session with Errors** view shows the last language tool triggered in user sessions where an error occurred. A high count for a particular tool does not necessarily indicate a quality issue with that tool, as we do not distinguish between user errors and system errors in this data. Likewise, a low count does **not automatically** imply higher quality. Its possible that some tools are not properly logging errors to the server, which could lead to underreporting. Therefore, both high and low counts should be interpreted with caution and in context.

tiles.title: New tile
tiles.markdownText:
## Collaboration Across Language Tools

Our goal is to always assist or guide users to invoke the most appropriate language tool at the right time to help them complete their tasks. The **Language Tool Chain view** illustrates the sequences in which different language tools are triggered. For example, a chain like **createMigrationPlan  migrateCode** is a clear patternafter generating a migration plan, the system invokes the **migrateCode** tool to help users begin code migration.

These chains may be implemented programmatically (e.g., automatically sending prompts to Copilot after certain commands), or they may be the result of thoughtful UX designsuch as displaying a prominent button after a response to guide users toward the next tool.

If the tool chains are overly concentrated around a few patterns, we should consider how to improve the experience for the less frequent chains to encourage broader usage in practice.

The **# of Language Tool Chain** view can also provide insights into funnel performance. For example, by combining the data from the chains **createMigrationPlan  migrateCode** and **migrateCode  createMigrationSummary**, we can infer the funnel for the full sequence: **createMigrationPlan  migrateCode  createMigrationSummary**. Chains that belong to the same workflow sequence typically appear along the diagonal in the view, helping us visually identify and analyze complete tool usage paths.

The **Terminal Language Tool Chain** view shows the final chain triggered before users end their session. If this view is also overly concentrated, it may indicate that certain chains are blocking further progress. In such cases, we should reflect on what follow-up actions were expected after those chainsand why users didnt proceed as intended. Of course, its also possible that some chains are designed to be natural endpoints.

queries.text:
let start = startofday(ago(28d));
let end = startofday(now());
let tmpTable = RawEventsTraces
| where timestamp between (start .. end)
| extend data = parse_json(message)
| extend dimensions = parse_json(customDimensions)
| extend machineId = tostring(dimensions.machineid)
| extend vscodeMachineId = tostring(data.vscodeMachineId);
let vscodeMachineIdMap = tmpTable
| where not(isempty(machineId)) and not(isempty(vscodeMachineId))
| distinct machineId, vscodeMachineId;
let processedTable = tmpTable
| join kind=leftouter (vscodeMachineIdMap) on machineId
| extend machineId = iff(isempty(vscodeMachineId1), machineId, vscodeMachineId1)
| extend internal = tobool(data.internal);
let internalTable = processedTable
| where internal == true
| summarize count = dcount(machineId) by bin(timestamp, 1d);
let externalTable = processedTable
| where internal == false
| summarize count = dcount(machineId) by bin(timestamp, 1d);
internalTable
| join kind=fullouter externalTable on timestamp
| extend timestamp = iff(isempty(timestamp), timestamp1, timestamp)
| extend InternalTotalUsers = iff(isempty(count), 0, count)
| extend ExternalTotalUsers = iff(isempty(count1), 0, count1)
| project timestamp, ['Internal Total Users'] = InternalTotalUsers, ['External Total Users'] = ExternalTotalUsers
| render list

let processedTable = RawEventsTraces
| where timestamp > ago(28d)
| where operation_Name == 'java/appcat/project'
| extend dimensions = parse_json(customDimensions)

| extend data = parse_json(message)
| extend internal = tobool(data.internal)

let internalTable = processedTable

let externalTable = processedTable

internalTable

| extend timestamp = iff(isempty(timestamp), timestamp1, timestamp)
| extend InternalTotalApps = iff(isempty(count), 0, count)

| render list

let start = startofday(ago(28d));
let end   = startofday(now());
let labelTable = RawEventsTraces
| where timestamp between (start .. end)
| where operation_Name == 'java/appcat/report'
| extend data = parse_json(message)
| extend dimensions = parse_json(customDimensions)
| extend labels = tostring(dimensions.report_labels)
| extend labelList = split(labels, ',')
| mv-expand labelEle = labelList
| extend label = tostring(labelEle)
| project operation_Id, label;
let categoryTable = labelTable
| where label startswith "category="
| extend category = substring(label, 9);
let sourceCategoryTable = labelTable
| where label startswith "source-category="
| extend sourceCategory = substring(label, 16);
categoryTable
| join kind=leftouter sourceCategoryTable on operation_Id
| summarize Count = count() by category, sourceCategory
| sort by Count desc
| limit 10
| project Category = category, ["Source category"] = sourceCategory, Count
| render list

database('VSCodeExt').RawEventsVSCodeExt
| where ClientTimestamp between (startofday(_startTime) .. (startofday(_endTime) - 1s))
| where ClientTimestamp >= datetime(2025-05-20)
| where ExtensionName contains "migrate-java-to-azure"
| where (EventName contains "java/migrateassistant/llmcall" or EventName contains "javaMigrationCopilot/llmcall")
| union (
    RawEventsVSCodeExt
| where ClientTimestamp between (_startTime .. (startofday(_endTime) - 1s))
| where ClientTimestamp >= datetime(2025-05-20)
| where ExtensionName == 'GitHub.copilot-chat'
// | where Properties contains "modernization_planner"
| where EventName == "github.copilot-chat/panel.request"
| where Properties.conversationid in (
    RawEventsVSCodeExt
| where ClientTimestamp between (_startTime .. (startofday(_endTime) - 1s))
| where ClientTimestamp >= datetime(2025-05-20)
// | where ExtensionName == 'Microsoft.migrate-java-to-azure'
| where ExtensionName == 'GitHub.copilot-chat'
| where Properties contains "createMigrationPlan"
| where EventName == "github.copilot-chat/toolcalldetails"
| project Properties.conversationid)
)
| join kind=leftouter database('VsCodeInsights').fact_user_isinternal on DevDeviceId
| extend internal  = iff(tobool(IsInternal1), 'Internal Users', 'External Users')
| where iif(user_source == 'internal', internal == 'Internal Users', iif(user_source == 'total', true, internal == 'External Users'))
| where isnotempty(DevDeviceId)
| summarize count=count()

let start=startofday(_startTime);
let end=startofday(_endTime);
database('VSCodeExt').RawEventsVSCodeExt
| where ClientTimestamp between (start .. end - 1s)
| where ClientTimestamp >= datetime(2025-05-20)
| where ExtensionName contains "migrate-java-to-azure"
| where (EventName contains "java/migrateassistant/llmcall" or EventName contains "javaMigrationCopilot/llmcall")

// | where ExtensionName == 'Microsoft.migrate-java-to-azure'
| where ExtensionName == 'GitHub.copilot-chat'
| where Properties contains "createMigrationPlan"
| where EventName == "github.copilot-chat/toolcalldetails"
| project Properties.conversationid, ClientTimestamp)
)
| join kind=leftouter database('VsCodeInsights').fact_user_isinternal on DevDeviceId
| extend internal  = iff(tobool(IsInternal1), 'Internal Users', 'External Users')
| where iif(user_source == 'internal', internal == 'Internal Users', iif(user_source == 'total', true, internal == 'External Users'))
| where isnotempty(DevDeviceId)
| summarize count=count() by bin(ClientTimestamp, 1d)

fact_activity_daily_ext
| where ActivityDay between (startofday(_startTime) .. (startofday(_endTime) - 1s))
| where ActivityDay >= datetime(2025-05-20)
| where ExtensionId in ("microsoft.migrate-java-to-azure", 'vscjava.migrate-java-to-azure')
| where Action in ('Install')
| join kind=leftouter (IdMapping_VSCode_AzureExt | summarize arg_max(DayUsed, DevDeviceId) by VSCodeMachineId) on VSCodeMachineId
| join kind=leftouter database('VSCodeInsights').fact_user_isinternal on DevDeviceId
| extend internal  = iff(tobool(IsInternal), 'Internal Users', 'External Users')
| where iif(user_source == 'internal', internal == 'Internal Users', iif(user_source == 'total', true, internal == 'External Users'))
| summarize count()

fact_activity_daily_ext

| where ClientTimestamp >= datetime(2025-05-20)
| where ExtensionName contains "migrate-java-to-azure"
| where EventName contains "java/migrateassistant/command"
| where tostring(Properties.command) == 'migrate.java.formula.importFromLocal'
| extend migrateaction=tostring(Properties.migrateaction), formula=tostring(Properties.formula), command=tostring(Properties.command), prompt=tostring(Properties.prompt)
| join kind=leftouter database('VsCodeInsights').fact_user_isinternal on DevDeviceId
| extend internal  = iff(tobool(IsInternal1), 'Internal Users', 'External Users')
| where iif(user_source == 'internal', internal == 'Internal Users', iif(user_source == 'total', true, internal == 'External Users'))
| summarize count=count() by bin(ClientTimestamp, 1d)

database('VSCodeExt').RawEventsVSCodeExt
| where ClientTimestamp between (startofday(ago(28d)) .. startofday(now())-1s)
| where ClientTimestamp >= datetime(2025-05-20)
| where ExtensionName contains "migrate-java-to-azure"
| where EventName contains "java/migrateassistant/command"
| extend command = tostring(Properties.command) 
| where command in ('migrate.java.assessment', 'migrate.java.assessment.solutionReport', 'migrate.java.assessment.summaryReport', 'migrate.java.openSolutionMigrateView')
| join kind=leftouter database('VsCodeInsights').fact_user_isinternal on DevDeviceId
| extend internal  = iff(tobool(IsInternal1), 'Internal Users', 'External Users')
| where iif(user_source == 'internal', internal == 'Internal Users', iif(user_source == 'total', true, internal == 'External Users'))
| extend command_alias = case(
    command == 'migrate.java.assessment', 'Run Assessment',
    command == 'migrate.java.assessment.solutionReport', 'Open Solution Report',
    command == 'migrate.java.assessment.summaryReport', 'Open Summary Report',
    command == 'migrate.java.openSolutionMigrateView', 'Open Solution Migration View',
    command // fallback: keep original if unmatched
)
| summarize countByUser=dcount(VSCodeMachineId) by command_alias

database('VSCodeExt').RawEventsVSCodeExt
| where ClientTimestamp between (startofday(_startTime) .. (startofday(_endTime) - 1s))
| where ClientTimestamp >= datetime(2025-05-20)
| where ExtensionName contains "migrate-java-to-azure"
| extend error=tostring(Properties.error), formula=tostring(Properties.formula), result=tostring(Properties.result), isMicrosoft=tobool(Properties.ismicrosoft)
| join kind=leftouter database('VsCodeInsights').fact_user_isinternal on DevDeviceId
| extend internal  = iff(tobool(IsInternal1), 'Internal Users', 'External Users')
| where iif(user_source == 'internal', internal == 'Internal Users', iif(user_source == 'total', true, internal == 'External Users'))
| where isnotempty( error) and error !in ("F", "TypeError", "Error", "ENOENT", "ERR_INVALID_ARG_TYPE")//skip code bug
| summarize count=count() by error
| order by count desc
| limit 20

let appcatRuns = cluster('ddtelai.kusto.windows.net').database('Copilot').RawEventsTraces
| where timestamp between (_startTime .. _endTime)
| where operation_Id != operation_ParentId
| where operation_Name == 'java/appcat/command'
| extend message = parse_json(message)
| extend internal = tobool(message.internal)
| where user_source == 'total' or user_source == 'internal' and internal or user_source == 'external' and not(internal)
| extend tool = 'AppCAT'
| project timestamp, session = operation_ParentId, tool;
let copilotRuns = cluster('ddtelvscode.kusto.windows.net').database('VSCodeExt').RawEventsVSCodeExt
| where ServerTimestamp between (_startTime .. _endTime)
| where ExtensionName == "GitHub.copilot-chat"
| where user_source == 'total' or user_source == 'internal' and IsInternal or user_source == 'external' and not(IsInternal)
| extend Command   = tostring(Properties['command']), Tools = tostring(Properties['toolcounts']);
let codeRemediationRuns = copilotRuns
| where Command == 'editAgent' and Tools has_any ('"createMigrationPlan"', '"migrateCode"', '"migration_codeChange"', '"migration_progressTool"', '"buildFix_agent"', '"buildFix_guideline"', '"buildFix_getBuildErrors"', '"cve_fixTool"', '"assessApplication"', '"createMigrationSummary"')
| extend tool = 'Code Remediation'
| project timestamp = ServerTimestamp, session = VSCodeSessionId, tool;
let javaUpgradeRuns = copilotRuns
| where Command == 'editAgent' and Tools has ('javaupgrade_')
| extend tool = 'Java Upgrade'
| project timestamp = ServerTimestamp, session = VSCodeSessionId, tool;
let allRuns = union appcatRuns, codeRemediationRuns, javaUpgradeRuns
| sort by session, timestamp asc;
allRuns
| summarize count = dcount(tool) by session
| extend label = strcat(iff(count == 1, 'Singel', iff(count == 2, 'Double', 'Triple')), '-product Sessions')
| summarize Sessions = count() by label

let copilotRuns = cluster('ddtelvscode.kusto.windows.net').database('VSCodeExt').RawEventsVSCodeExt
| where ServerTimestamp between (_startTime .. _endTime)
| where ExtensionName == "GitHub.copilot-chat"
| where user_source == 'total' or user_source == 'internal' and IsInternal or user_source == 'external' and not(IsInternal)
| extend Command   = tostring(Properties['command']), Tools = tostring(Properties['toolcounts']);
let languageToolRuns = copilotRuns
| where Command == 'editAgent' and (Tools has_any ('"createMigrationPlan"', '"migrateCode"', '"migration_codeChange"', '"migration_progressTool"', '"buildFix_agent"', '"buildFix_guideline"', '"buildFix_getBuildErrors"', '"cve_fixTool"', '"assessApplication"', '"createMigrationSummary"') or Tools has ('javaupgrade_'))
| extend languageTool = extract('"(.*?)"', 1, Tools)
| project timestamp = ServerTimestamp, session = VSCodeSessionId, languageTool;
let allRuns = languageToolRuns
| sort by session, timestamp asc;
allRuns
| summarize val = count() by session
| extend RunsBucket = case (
    val > 100,
    "> 100",
    val > 50 and val <= 100 ,
    "51-100",
    val > 20 and val <= 50 ,
    "21-50",
    val > 10 and val <= 20 ,
    "11-20",
    val > 5 and val <= 10 ,
    "6-10",
    val > 2 and val <= 5,
    "3-5",
    val == 2,
    "2",
    "1"
  )
| summarize Sessions=count() by RunsBucket
| order by Sessions desc
| project ['Tool Runs'] = RunsBucket, Sessions

    "1-5 min",
    "less than 1 min"
  )

| where ServerTimestamp between (_startTime .. _endTime)
| where ExtensionName == "GitHub.copilot-chat"
| where user_source == 'total' or user_source == 'internal' and IsInternal or user_source == 'external' and not(IsInternal)
| extend Command   = tostring(Properties['command']), Tools = tostring(Properties['toolcounts']);

| where Command == 'editAgent' and (Tools has_any ('"createMigrationPlan"', '"migrateCode"', '"migration_codeChange"', '"migration_progressTool"', '"buildFix_agent"', '"buildFix_guideline"', '"buildFix_getBuildErrors"', '"cve_fixTool"', '"assessApplication"', '"createMigrationSummary"') or Tools has ('javaupgrade_'))
| extend languageTool = extract('"(.*?)"', 1, Tools)

| summarize Count = count() by prev_tool, languageTool
| sort by Count
| project Tool = prev_tool, ['Next Tool'] = languageTool, Count

let copilotRuns = cluster('ddtelvscode.kusto.windows.net').database('VSCodeExt').RawEventsVSCodeExt
| where ServerTimestamp between (_startTime .. _endTime)
| where ExtensionName == "GitHub.copilot-chat"
| where user_source == 'total' or user_source == 'internal' and IsInternal or user_source == 'external' and not(IsInternal)
| extend Command   = tostring(Properties['command']), Tools = tostring(Properties['toolcounts']);
let languageToolRuns = copilotRuns
| where Command == 'editAgent' and (Tools has_any ('"createMigrationPlan"', '"migrateCode"', '"migration_codeChange"', '"migration_progressTool"', '"buildFix_agent"', '"buildFix_guideline"', '"buildFix_getBuildErrors"', '"cve_fixTool"', '"assessApplication"', '"createMigrationSummary"') or Tools has ('javaupgrade_'))
| extend languageTool = extract('"(.*?)"', 1, Tools)
| project timestamp = ServerTimestamp, session = VSCodeSessionId, languageTool;
let terminalToolRuns = languageToolRuns
| summarize arg_max(timestamp, languageTool) by session;
let toolChain = languageToolRuns
| sort by session, timestamp asc
| serialize row_id=row_number()
| extend prev_tool = prev(languageTool), prev_session = prev(session)
| where session == prev_session and languageTool == prev_tool;
toolChain
| join kind=inner terminalToolRuns on timestamp, session
| summarize Count = count() by prev_tool, languageTool
| order by Count
| project Tool = languageTool, Count

| where ServerTimestamp between (_startTime .. _endTime)
| where ExtensionName == "vscjava.vscode-java-upgrade"
| where user_source == 'total' or user_source == 'internal' and IsInternal or user_source == 'external' and not(IsInternal)
| extend error = tostring(Properties.errormessage)

| distinct VSCodeSessionId;
let codeRemediationErrorSessions = cluster('ddtelvscode.kusto.windows.net').database('VSCodeExt').RawEventsVSCodeExt
| where ServerTimestamp between (_startTime .. _endTime)
| where ExtensionName has "migrate-java-to-azure"
| where user_source == 'total' or user_source == 'internal' and IsInternal or user_source == 'external' and not(IsInternal)
| extend error = tostring(Properties.error)
| where isnotempty(error) and error !in ("F", "TypeError", "Error", "ENOENT", "ERR_INVALID_ARG_TYPE")
| distinct VSCodeSessionId;
let errorSessions = union javaUpgradeErrorSessions, codeRemediationErrorSessions
| distinct session = VSCodeSessionId;

| where session in (errorSessions);

| summarize arg_max(timestamp, languageTool) by session
| summarize terminalCount = count() by languageTool
